subject: Learning
title: The Power of Storytelling
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Power of Storytelling.

hook.text: Children who hear stories regularly score higher in empathy, vocabulary, and comprehension than those who don't.

buildup.text: Stories are how humans have transmitted knowledge for millennia. Children's brains are wired to learn from narrative.

discovery.text: Narrative structure helps children organize events, understand cause and effect, and develop temporal reasoning.

twist.text: Interactive storytellingâ€”where children ask questions and make predictionsâ€”is far more effective than passive listening.

climax.text: Stories don't just teach content. They teach how to think, feel, and make sense of the world.

punchline.text: Tell children stories. It's the oldest and most powerful teaching technology.

quiz.question: Why is interactive storytelling more effective than passive listening?
options: Children who ask questions and make predictions engage more deeply with the narrative
Passive listening is actually more effective
Interactive storytelling only works for fiction
